Try making sure your PATH and LD_LIBRARY_PATH variables are being set properly; those were causing a similar issue for me.

In case you forgot to set those variables, add one of the following snippets to the end of your ~/.profile:

export PATH=/usr/local/cuda-9.0/bin${PATH:+:${PATH}}
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib\
                         ${LD_LIBRARY_PATH:+:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}}

or, if you're running a 64-bit system:

export PATH=/usr/local/cuda-9.0/bin${PATH:+:${PATH}}
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64\
                         ${LD_LIBRARY_PATH:+:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}}

then run source ~/.profile and try running tensorflow again
body:
Try making sure your `PATH` and `LD_LIBRARY_PATH` variables are being set properly; those were causing a similar issue for me.

In case you forgot to set those variables, add one of the following snippets to the end of your `~/.profile`:
```
export PATH=/usr/local/cuda-9.0/bin${PATH:+:${PATH}}
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib\
                         ${LD_LIBRARY_PATH:+:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}}
```
or, if you're running a 64-bit system:
```
export PATH=/usr/local/cuda-9.0/bin${PATH:+:${PATH}}
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64\
                         ${LD_LIBRARY_PATH:+:${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}}
```

then run `source ~/.profile` and try running tensorflow again
